content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function defined by <math alttext="f of x, equals, the fraction with numerator 1 minus 5 x, minus 2 times x squared, and denominator 3 times x squared, plus 7, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo></mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="x greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following is a horizontal asymptote to the graph of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="y equals negative two thirds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>
There is no horizontal asymptote to the graph of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="y equals negative two thirds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 1.15: Connecting Limits at Infinity and Horizontal Asymptotes

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
